items.content: Analysts will be watching to see if Thrive-owned firms actually succeed in building long-term profitable businesses using OpenAI’s tech, or if the result is really just pumped up valuations based on speculative market potential.

items.translated_title: Nvidia’s $2B Synopsys bet tightens its grip on the chip-design stack
items.content: The $2 billion investment in Synopsys, which makes software and components for designing semiconductor chips, deepens their existing partnership at a time when analysts scrutinize circular AI-industry deals and warn of a potential bubble.

items.translated_title: Amazon’s AI chatbot Rufus drove sales on Black Friday
items.content: On Black Friday, Amazon sessions that resulted in a sale were up 100% in the U.S. when the AI chatbot Rufus was used. They only increased by 20% when Rufus wasn't used.

items.translated_title: VC Kara Nortman bet early on women’s sports, and now she’s creating the market
items.content: As women's sports enters what feels like a sustained boom period -- the Golden State Valkyries just played their first WNBA next season, the NWSL is expanding, media rights deals are growing -- Nortman remains cautiously optimistic about whether this moment will prove different from past surges in interest.

items.title: Supabase hit $5B by turning down million-dollar contracts. Here’s why.
items.creator: Theresa Loconsolo
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Supabase hit $5B by turning down million-dollar contracts. Here’s why.
items.content: Vibe coding has taken the tech industry by storm, and it’s not just the Lovables and Replits of the world that are winning. The startups building the infrastructure behind them are cashing in too.  Supabase, the open-source database platform that’s become the backend of choice for the vibe-coding world, raised $100 million at a $5 billion valuation just months after closing $200 million at $2 billion. But co-founder and CEO […]
